name: Kilmichael Country House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights and felt at home from the moment we arrived. It is a small country house hotel about a mile outside Brodick, the main village on the island. This was perfect for us - we eat at the hotel one night and two at pubs in the village.
reviews.title: This place is special!

likes.disliked: — leave the car at home and use your legs!

reviews.text: The food at the hotel was very good indeed but the menu is limited (for very good reason) and we enjoyed trying out other places. We walked to the village down the pot-holed track (usually in the rain!) but this just added to the special nature of the place.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: On one of the days we did a 15-mile circuit up Goat Fell. You can do this walk right from the hotel (or choose shorter routes) and it is exhilarating but very hard work.
reviews.title: My Favourite Place

reviews.text: The decor and staff (mainly Vietnamese when we were there) at the hotel were just about perfect. Our bedroom was somewhere we felt at home in an instant.
reviews.title: A very special place
Excellent Getaway
reviews.text: Some people say that Arran is Scotland in miniature and I think they are right. It's got the lot if you want a short break in breathtaking scenery, but take some good books for those rainy days when it's nice to just enjoy the hotel.

reviews.title: Comfortable and elegant
reviews.text: This is an excellent country house hotel. The housekeeper told us that it reverts to a private home when the tourist season is over, and it definitely has that feel -- it's comfortable as well as elegant, and the owner/host is very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Fullarton suite, on the first floor, where the two sitting rooms are located. Apart from immediately before and after dinner, we had the sitting rooms to ourselves -- books, a fire, tea or gin and tonics, depending on your mood. There was even a piano, but we decided not to inflict our lack of musical talent on anyone else!

reviews.title: A wonderful retreat
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good (why does "porridge" in Scotland always taste better than "oatmeal" in the U.S.?) The dinner menu is limited but generally well thought out, although one night there were only fish and shellfish for starters. After a day of walking, it was wonderful to be able to stumble upstairs after dinner, and straight into a very comfortable bed. The little dram of whiskey in the room was a nice touch, too.

aka: Kilmichael Country House Hotel Brodick, Isle Of Arran
description: Quality, comfort and style are the hallmarks of the Kilmichael experience. All the rooms are elegantly and individually decorated to maintain the look and feel of a particularly attractive country house, while offering the standards of comfort and service associated with the very best hotels. Indeed, Kilmichael has twice been awarded 'Scottish Country House Hotel of the Year' and consistently achieves higher grades than other island hotels in every major guidebook and award scheme.
